message: and a mathod on the model that parses the YAML and returns the compiled dict
i may eventually move this data into it's own model, but it's very flexible and not at all stable yet
any tips on how I could have that data compiled and added as an attribute on my model when the object is loaded?
I've got a model that I want to keep some semi-structured data for
right now i've just got a TextField with some yaml in it
I ran across mentions of PickleField and JSONField in this SO post: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/402217/how-to-store-a-dictionary-on-a-django-model
I've had good results using the JSONField implementation in https://github.com/django-extensions/django-extensions/blob/master/django_extensions/db/fields/json.py
The JSONField worked out quite well in a recent project which has a large amount of arbitrary metadata which is not only not known in advance but can actually change frequently with no notice
https://github.com/jordanm/django-hstore is also intriguing if you meet the (Django 1.2+, PostgreSQL 9.0+, and Psycopg 2.3+) requirements
thanks, I'll check them out!
For these situations, I've used a nosql solution like CouchDB. You could easily set a method on your model to be getter/setters for a couch document
don't want to spread in-flux data models across too many data-stores
I do remember hearing something about postgresql having list and dictionary fields.
@emperorcezar - yes, that's the ultimate plan, but i'm trying to keep the data close for now until I have a better idea of how it's used
Setting up couch and tying it in was pretty easy for us.
yeha, i've got mongo running, i just have better things to do at this point than futz with it :)
@emperorcezar see the django-hstore mention above
I share the NoSQL interest but JSON in a DB is nice for not spooking the ops people (much as some deserve being dragged out of the early 90s)
@acdha "spooking the ops people" <- brilliant comment.
I quite like django-picklefield http://pypi.python.org/pypi/django-picklefield/0.1.9
Ha. "Spooking the ops people". Couch is super simple to install and Admin. Though I understand your point.
